meanings.definition: A belief or practice that goes against established norms or conventions.
meanings.sent1: Her counterconvention of wearing pajamas to work raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent2: The protest was a powerful counterconvention against the status quo.
meanings.sent3: At the fancy dinner, his counterconvention of eating dessert first caused a stir.
meanings.sent4: In a world of black and white, she was a burst of color, a counterconvention in every way.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work was a beautiful counterconvention, challenging viewers to see beyond the ordinary.

meanings.definition: An event or gathering that opposes or challenges traditional conventions.
meanings.sent1: The underground concert was a thrilling counterconvention of mainstream music.
meanings.sent2: The street parade was a lively counterconvention to the usual quiet neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party was a delightful counterconvention to his usual birthday routine.
meanings.sent4: The art exhibition was a visual counterconvention, showcasing unconventional pieces.
meanings.sent5: The flash mob was a spontaneous counterconvention, surprising everyone in the square.

meanings.definition: To act in opposition to established conventions or norms.
meanings.sent1: She decided to counterconvention by starting her own business instead of following the traditional career path.
meanings.sent2: The students planned to counterconvention by organizing a peaceful protest against the new school policy.
meanings.sent3: He liked to counterconvention by taking the scenic route home, enjoying the journey more than the destination.
meanings.sent4: The rebellious artist chose to counterconvention by creating art that challenged societal expectations.
meanings.sent5: The young inventor sought to counterconvention by designing a device that revolutionized everyday tasks.
